Connecting Fractions to Decimals

Terminating decimals can be written as fractions with a power of 10, such as 10, 100, 1000 and 10,000 in the denominator. For example,
But not all fractions can be written as decimals that terminate. For example, when you divide 2 by 3, the decimal keeps repeating. The ellipsis (3 dots) on the decimal shows that it repeats.

Is it possible to predict which fractions will have terminating decimals and which ones will have repeating decimal representations?

In this problem we will explore some interesting patterns with fractions that will help answer this question.
